00079 const char* regressionTest(const BinaryDataEncoder::Config& config)
00080 {
00081     if (config.precision == BinaryDataEncoder::Precision_32 &&
00082         config.byteOrder == BinaryDataEncoder::ByteOrder_LittleEndian && 
00083         config.compression == BinaryDataEncoder::Compression_None)
00084         return sampleEncoded32Little_;
00085 
00086     if (config.precision == BinaryDataEncoder::Precision_32 &&
00087         config.byteOrder == BinaryDataEncoder::ByteOrder_BigEndian &&
00088         config.compression == BinaryDataEncoder::Compression_None)
00089         return sampleEncoded32Big_;
00090 
00091     if (config.precision == BinaryDataEncoder::Precision_64 &&
00092         config.byteOrder == BinaryDataEncoder::ByteOrder_LittleEndian &&
00093         config.compression == BinaryDataEncoder::Compression_None)
00094         return sampleEncoded64Little_;
00095 
00096     if (config.precision == BinaryDataEncoder::Precision_64 &&
00097         config.byteOrder == BinaryDataEncoder::ByteOrder_BigEndian &&
00098         config.compression == BinaryDataEncoder::Compression_None)
00099         return sampleEncoded64Big_;
00100 
00101     if (config.precision == BinaryDataEncoder::Precision_32 &&
00102         config.byteOrder == BinaryDataEncoder::ByteOrder_LittleEndian && 
00103         config.compression == BinaryDataEncoder::Compression_Zlib)
00104         return sampleEncoded32LittleZlib_;
00105      
00106     if (config.precision == BinaryDataEncoder::Precision_32 &&
00107         config.byteOrder == BinaryDataEncoder::ByteOrder_BigEndian && 
00108         config.compression == BinaryDataEncoder::Compression_Zlib)
00109         return sampleEncoded32BigZlib_;
00110 
00111     if (config.precision == BinaryDataEncoder::Precision_64 &&
00112         config.byteOrder == BinaryDataEncoder::ByteOrder_LittleEndian && 
00113         config.compression == BinaryDataEncoder::Compression_Zlib)
00114         return sampleEncoded64LittleZlib_;
00115      
00116     if (config.precision == BinaryDataEncoder::Precision_64 &&
00117         config.byteOrder == BinaryDataEncoder::ByteOrder_BigEndian && 
00118         config.compression == BinaryDataEncoder::Compression_Zlib)
00119         return sampleEncoded64BigZlib_;
00120 
00121      throw runtime_error("[BinaryDataEncoderTest::regressionTest()] Untested configuration.");
00122 }
00123 
00124  
00125 void testConfiguration(const BinaryDataEncoder::Config& config)
00126 {
00127     if (os_)
00128         *os_ << "testConfiguration: " << config << endl;
00129 
00130     // initialize scan data
00131 
00132     vector<double> binary(sampleDataSize_);
00133     copy(sampleData_, sampleData_+sampleDataSize_, binary.begin());
00134 
00135     if (os_)
00136     {
00137         *os_ << "original: " << binary.size() << endl;
00138         *os_ << setprecision(20) << fixed;
00139         copy(binary.begin(), binary.end(), ostream_iterator<double>(*os_, "\n")); 
00140     }
00141 
00142     // instantiate encoder
00143 
00144     BinaryDataEncoder encoder(config);
00145 
00146     // encode
00147 
00148     string encoded;
00149     encoder.encode(binary, encoded);
00150 
00151     if (os_)
00152         *os_ << "encoded: " << encoded.size() << endl << encoded << endl;
00153 
00154     // regression testing for encoding
00155 
00156     unit_assert(encoded == regressionTest(config));
00157 
00158     // decode
00159 
00160     vector<double> decoded;
00161     encoder.decode(encoded, decoded);
00162 
00163     if (os_)
00164     {
00165         *os_ << "decoded: " << decoded.size() << endl;
00166         copy(decoded.begin(), decoded.end(), ostream_iterator<double>(*os_, "\n")); 
00167     }
00168 
00169     // validate by comparing scan data before/after encode/decode
00170 
00171     unit_assert(binary.size() == decoded.size());
00172 
00173     const double epsilon = config.precision == BinaryDataEncoder::Precision_64 ? 1e-14 : 1e-5 ;
00174 
00175     for (vector<double>::const_iterator it=binary.begin(), jt=decoded.begin();  
00176          it!=binary.end(); ++it, ++jt)
00177     {
00178         unit_assert_equal(*it, *jt, epsilon);
00179     }
00180 
00181     if (os_) *os_ << "validated with epsilon: " << fixed << setprecision(1) << scientific << epsilon << "\n\n";
00182 }
00183 
00184 
00185 void test()
00186 {
00187     BinaryDataEncoder::Config config;
00188 
00189     config.precision = BinaryDataEncoder::Precision_32;
00190     config.byteOrder = BinaryDataEncoder::ByteOrder_LittleEndian;
00191     testConfiguration(config);
00192     
00193     config.precision = BinaryDataEncoder::Precision_32;
00194     config.byteOrder = BinaryDataEncoder::ByteOrder_BigEndian;
00195     testConfiguration(config);
00196 
00197     config.precision = BinaryDataEncoder::Precision_64;
00198     config.byteOrder = BinaryDataEncoder::ByteOrder_LittleEndian;
00199     testConfiguration(config);
00200 
00201     config.precision = BinaryDataEncoder::Precision_64;
00202     config.byteOrder = BinaryDataEncoder::ByteOrder_BigEndian;
00203     testConfiguration(config);
00204 
00205     config.precision = BinaryDataEncoder::Precision_32;
00206     config.byteOrder = BinaryDataEncoder::ByteOrder_LittleEndian;
00207     config.compression = BinaryDataEncoder::Compression_Zlib;
00208     testConfiguration(config);
00209 
00210     config.precision = BinaryDataEncoder::Precision_32;
00211     config.byteOrder = BinaryDataEncoder::ByteOrder_BigEndian;
00212     config.compression = BinaryDataEncoder::Compression_Zlib;
00213     testConfiguration(config);
00214 
00215     config.precision = BinaryDataEncoder::Precision_64;
00216     config.byteOrder = BinaryDataEncoder::ByteOrder_LittleEndian;
00217     config.compression = BinaryDataEncoder::Compression_Zlib;
00218     testConfiguration(config);
00219 
00220     config.precision = BinaryDataEncoder::Precision_64;
00221     config.byteOrder = BinaryDataEncoder::ByteOrder_BigEndian;
00222     config.compression = BinaryDataEncoder::Compression_Zlib;
00223     testConfiguration(config);
00224 }

00226 
00227 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00228 {
00229     try
00230     {
00231         if (argc>1 && !strcmp(argv[1],"-v")) os_ = &cout;
00232         if (os_) *os_ << "BinaryDataEncoderTest\n\n";
00233         test();
00234         return 0;
00235     }
00236     catch (exception& e)
00237     {
00238         cerr << e.what() << endl;
00239         return 1;
00240     }
00241 }
